reviews.review: Took me forever to finally play this because I was pretty meh about the first two. It's better than those, but it does have some of the same problems those games had. The world is way more interesting than the actual game. Gameplay often feels tedious, like everything you do is just wasting your time and deliberately dragging out a story that should be moving faster. Enemies keep teleporting/appearing/dropping directly behind you. The narrative is heavily reliant on trying to make you feel remorse for decisions you "made", which either happened before the game began, or where you were forced to make because the story is entirely linear, so the impact isn't really there, like showing up to the first day of a job and having people try to blame you for stuff that happened months ago. My main takeaway is the same as from Bioshock 1 and 2. The writers aren't as deep as they think they are, and this would make a way more interesting mockumentary than it does a game.
MUY BUEN JUEGO, EN ESPECIAL LOS DLC DONDE SE EXPLICA TODO
Exciting, Action packed, fast paced, good use of music, interesting story
ESTE JUEGO ES MUUUUUUY BUENO SU HISTORIA Y SU JUGABILIDAD ESTAN NAZIIIIIIII
what in fucks name just happened
J-E-G-A-S-O la verdad que esta muy bien adaptado para cerrar esta trilogia llena de suspenso y accion, no tiene desperdicio alguno

Infinitie kinda good tho. Maybe it was because i didnt even know this game came out, so i had no hype, but the gameplay is real fun and the story i like, reminds me a lot of last of us with how you hang out with a girlie who changes the main character from grizzled boy to nice guy. Hmmmm i wonder which came out first?

Bioshock Infinite is a masterpiece of  a game, after playing through the whole series, this game is the best one out of the three in my opinion.

The story, the combat, and gameplay are just hard to beat, and are so much more enjoyable than it is in the other 2 Bioshock games.

If you can I recommend you buy this game for you wont regret it.

This game saved my life.

I am 42.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you
My favorite game of all time. Not just an FPS. But a beautifully detailed journey through music, visual art, and moral themes

What a strange concept for a game. Game took me 13 hours on and off.
This is the first BioShock game I've played and i found it difficult to get used to the layout/controls of the game at first but I did get used to it.
I enjoyed playing BioShock and I do recommend.

Rating 7/10

Played this game quickly when it first came out. Playing it again now (2021) and love it. I'd have to say it's equal to (if not slightly better) than Bioshocks 1/2. After playing Bioshock 1/2 so much over the years, a break from the dark but awesome atmosphere of those games is exactly what I needed and I think this is what Bioshock Infinite fullfills perfectly.

To sum up, the game's good and I'm definitely recommending you to buy Bioshock Collection.

This game is legitimately programming. You start the game and are greeted by a cult that seems like what a lefty would view as Christianity. Even pseudo-depictions of Mary, Joseph and Jesus. Okay, maybe it's just a thing. You get further, American flags everywhere, founding fathers. Sweet. Progress further, evil white conservatives preparing to murder an interracial couple. Um...okay. Then a little more, flashes of American flags everywhere, then soldiers that look a hell of a lot like Nazis jumping around. You enter a house, black people hiding inside and the police banging on the door saying "OPEN UP". A poster on the wall saying "Until the negro is equal nobody is equal" (Sounds similar to "until black lives matter no lives matter" eh?). Walk down the hall, more presidential figures everywhere, barrages of Nazis, and literally ships with American flags flying all over the place in the background. This is honestly shocking how blatant the conditioning is. Every single element of this game is just waving lefty propaganda in your face. Totally counter-culture bro, AAA titles from billionaire corporations shilling your ideology.

Recomiendo bastante este juego, su jugabilidad e historia son bastante buenos y tiene muy buenos grÃ¡ficos. 
Lo que mas resalta en si seria la historia, es una bastante profunda y su argumento principal se basa en una teorÃ­a de la mecÃ¡nica cuÃ¡ntica que postula la posibilidad de la existencia de mÃºltiples o infinitos universos paralelos pero con algunas variantes, la teorÃ­a de "El gato de SchrÃ¶dinger" explica bastante bien esta paradoja que observamos durante el juego.

Este juego es un 10. Para empezar estÃ¡ la jugabilidad, que si bien no deja de ser un shooter, tiene los vigorizadores, que te permiten experimentar un montÃ³n y afrontar a los enemigos de diferentes formas. AdemÃ¡s, pueden ser mejorados, al igual que las armas, y las sales, que son lo que los vigorizadores consumen. TambiÃ©n hay ciertos objetos que te dan ventajas al hacer ciertas cosas. En eso el juego es muy divertido y cumple con creces.
En cuanto a la historia, no se queda atrÃ¡s, dejÃ¡ndome con la boca abierta con cada giro de trama, especialmente su final. Con la piel de gallina. Tanto es asÃ­ que seguro que vas a necesitar pasarte el juego al menos una segunda vez para entender todo y al hacerlo te darÃ¡s cuenta de que te lo estaban dejando caer desde un principio, y no te diste ni cuenta. 
Los personajes son tambiÃ©n un punto fuerte de este juego, siendo Elizabeth, nuestra compaÃ±era y protagonista junto a Booker, la que mas destaca. Durante el juego, ella puede encontrar municiÃ³n, sales, botiquines, dinero, y puede traer aliados y construcciones, como ganchos en el techo con los que acceder a terreno elevado, coberturas, cajas de municiÃ³n y salud al querer. Y para mi sorpresa la primera vez que juguÃ©, no hace falta protegerla durante el combate, porque se queda a un lado y los enemigos no la atacan. AdemÃ¡s es un encanto, y el elemento mÃ¡s importante de la historia.
La mÃºsica es sencillamente hermosa y se ajusta de maravilla a la situaciÃ³n. AquÃ­ no hay mucho que decir, simplemente escÃºchala y verÃ¡s a quÃ© me refiero.
Los grÃ¡ficos son muy buenos, y aunque es cierto que si vas al detalle y miras de cerca los objetos, puedes ver que no estÃ¡n muy bien detallados, este juego consigue que funcionen en conjunto y sea impresionante. No es tanto lo grÃ¡fico sinÃ³ los recursos que usa los que hacen que se vea tan hermoso. Es una maravilla visual, por mucho que no tenga grÃ¡ficos de ultima generaciÃ³n y esas mi*rdas. 
En cuanto a la dificultad, recomiendo empezarlo en difÃ­cil, porque la facil no la he probado pero la normal sÃ­ y si juegas a otros shooters de forma habitual, no va a tener mucha complicaciÃ³n. Y despuÃ©s estÃ¡ el modo 1999, que es ya otra cosa. Sigue sin ser demencial, porque me lo pasÃ© al dÃ­a siguiente de terminar en dificil, pero es un reto que recomiendo mucho. Se hubiera agradecido un modo +, que te permitiera iniciar una partida nueva con el dinero y mejoras de la Ãºltima, pero eso hubiese hecho el juego demasiado fÃ¡cil.
La duraciÃ³n del juego no decepciona. Es lo suficientemente larga para que valga la pena los 30â‚¬ que te has gastado en esta perlita. Antes he dicho que me pasÃ© el juego en su mÃ¡xima dificultad, al dia siguiente de terminarlo en difÃ­cil pero eso no significa mucho, porque era la tercera vez en una semana, y no jugaba a otra cosa desde que empecÃ©(y asÃ­ sigo), ademÃ¡s ya sabÃ­a donde tenÃ­a que ir y intentÃ© pasarmelo en el mÃ­nimo tiempo posible. La primera vez que juegues seguro que tardas mas de 10 horas, si no intentas recoger todos los coleccionables, claro.

Este juego no creo que te decepcione. A mÃ­ me ha encantado, es mÃ¡s, ahora es mi juego favorito de entre todos los que he jugado en mi vida. QuizÃ¡s tu juegues y no lo veas igual, pero no se puede decir que no es un juegazo. Recomendado al 100%.

Graphics and visuals still hold up well in 2021, the gun play and movement may feel clunky sometimes, but its still fun especially when you use the powers. The difficulty of the game can sometimes be inconsistent, you will find you can beat a good chunk of the game without any troubles, but have a few encounters where it really ramps up.

The story is a total mindfuck where i'm still trying to make sense of it, but I feel like it was well worth it to put in the time to get to the ending. The game doesn't make much sense when you're going through it, you might wonder how everything works, but there's a lot of contextual clues and hidden lore in audio tapes to piece some things together. The ending will make sense of the game, but at the same time may not, I personally looked up some ending analysis to make sense of it (not a fault of the game.. just a mindfuck of a story and my smooth brain).
